### Section 5. Ambulance and Transportation expenses

We will reimburse You up to a maximum of $20 per trip up to the Benefit Limit for:

1. the ambulance fee for emergency re-admittance to Hospital; and/or
2. Transportation Costs that You have incurred to travel to the Hospital for follow up treatment,

within ninety (90) days from the date of Your discharge from the Hospital.

We shall not be liable for more than (four) 4 trips for any one Injury or Illness.

The maximum amount We will pay for any one Period of Insurance is up to the Benefit Limit.

#### Exclusions Applicable to Section 5

No benefit will be payable under Section 5:

1. Loss that is covered by any other existing insurance scheme, government program or that it will be paid by other source(s). We will only pay the irrecoverable amount from such other source(s).

### Section 6. No Claim Bonus
questions: How does the policy define the maximum reimbursement for ambulance fees and transportation costs per trip and per Period of Insurance, and what are the limits on the number of trips covered for a single Injury or Illness?
In what scenarios would transportation costs to the hospital for follow-up treatment be reimbursed, and what is the time frame within which these costs must be incurred after hospital discharge?
How does the policy handle reimbursement if ambulance or transportation expenses are partially covered by another insurance scheme or government program?
What documentation or proof might be required to demonstrate that ambulance or transportation expenses are irrecoverable from other sources before the insurer reimburses under Section 5?
If a claimant requires more than four ambulance or transportation trips for the same Injury or Illness, how does the policy limit coverage, and what happens to additional trips beyond this limit?
How does the policy’s maximum Benefit Limit apply across multiple ambulance and transportation trips within one Period of Insurance?
Are transportation costs for follow-up treatments incurred beyond ninety days from hospital discharge covered under this policy section, and what implications does this timing have on claims?
How does the exclusion of losses covered by other insurance or government programs interact with the general policy exclusions, and which exclusion takes precedence in case of overlap?
If a claimant is readmitted to the hospital for an emergency related to a previous Injury or Illness, how does the policy cover ambulance fees for this re-admittance?
Does the policy cover transportation costs to the hospital for initial treatment or only for follow-up treatments, and how is this distinction important for claim eligibility?
How would the policy treat a situation where ambulance fees are covered by a government program but transportation costs for follow-up treatment are not, in terms of reimbursement?
What are the implications if a claimant incurs transportation costs for follow-up treatment but does not have hospital discharge documentation within the last ninety days?
How does the policy address claims for ambulance and transportation expenses if the Injury or Illness occurs near the end of the Period of Insurance and trips extend beyond that period?
In cases where multiple injuries or illnesses occur during the same Period of Insurance, how does the four-trip limit per Injury or Illness apply, and how is the Benefit Limit allocated?
What conditions must be met for ambulance fees to qualify as emergency re-admittance, and how might this affect claims for non-emergency transportation?
How does the policy ensure that the reimbursement for ambulance and transportation expenses does not exceed the actual irrecoverable amount when other sources partially cover the costs?
Are there any specific exclusions or limitations regarding the types of transportation costs reimbursed for follow-up treatment, such as private car versus public transport?
How does the policy define the start and end of the ninety-day period for transportation cost claims following hospital discharge, and what happens if treatment is delayed?
If a claimant receives ambulance services but the transportation to follow-up treatment is arranged by a family member without cost, how does this affect the claim under Section 5?
How does the policy’s exclusion for losses covered by other sources interact with potential subrogation rights or recovery actions by the insurer after reimbursing the irrecoverable amount?
